hackathon-description-text: Whether you're an accomplished programmer or whether you've never coded anything outside of class before, come hang out with us, learn something new, and build something cool.  Learn more about the hackathon and stay up to date on the competition and prizes at the HackCWRU website:
hackathon-requirements: You can submit anything you want just make sure it has a clear description of what you did!
hackathon-rules:
Don't work on your projects before the start time.
Limit team sizes to 5.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Flashstarts will be judging all completed hacks for a prize of $1000.
Judges will be awarding a Nexus 7 to a top hack of their choosing.
Case ITS will be awarding an iPad Mini to a top hack.
A cash prize of $750 will be awarded for the best hardware hack in memory of Dr. Steve Garverick of the CWRU Electrical Engineering Department.
An Xbox One will be awarded to a top hack.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=2095 Martin Luther King Junior Drive Nord Hall, Case Western Reserve University, Cleveland, OH 44106, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Judging will be based on different criteria. Stay tuned for updates!

hackathon-location-address: 2095 Martin Luther King Junior Drive Nord Hall, Case Western Reserve University, Cleveland, OH 44106, USA
